body: I was looking into a good reason for using fatih/color besides the fact that the code looks better... seems like now I have one :)
@caarlos0 set a reminder for **Today at 7:43 PM**

oh, problem is bigger than expected... apex/log doesn't use fatih/color it seems...

will talk to @tj and see if he accepts a PR for that :)

issue.title: cli: using fatih/color to better support windows
issue.body:
so, seems like it don't look very good on windows (https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/506), I've made some changes so we can use fatih/color to handle that.

let me know what you think.

for now I'll try to hack around on goreleaser.

issue.title: fix: colors on windows
issue.body:
closes #506

## Types of changes

<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->

* [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
* [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
* [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
* [x] I have read the **CONTRIBUTING** document.
* [x] `make ci` passes on my machine.
* [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation.
* [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
* [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes.

body: @wxio fixed to use fatih/color. Can you check the latest version (`v0.43.x`), please?
also thanks @tj for the quick accept on apex/log :)

issue.title: use colorable *os.File - needs for windows
issue.body:
Further fix to windows terminal colouring.

https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/506
https://github.com/apex/log/pull/53

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
